title.narrative: SLCDF 2016-2020 Strengthening Civil Society Structures for Sustainable Development

description.narrative: The Strengthening Civil Society Structures for Sustainable Development is Develop capacity and facilitate spaces for the civil society to access economic and social equity towards sustainable development. The civil society has played crucial role in the socio economic and political development in Sri Lanka. Having lamented and advocated for the opening of space for engagement, civil society now struggle to find ways engage and broaden the space. In the post war context the transformative phase is a period in which legitimate local capacities emerge and need to be supported. Special attention is needed for restarting the economy, including physical reconstruction, ensuring functional structures for governance and judicial processes in the conflict affected areas. The overall objective to strengthen the capacity of the Civil Society Organizations in the districts to become active participants in developing and implementing sustainable development strategies. Main activities focus on 1. Promote socio economic and political rights of the marginalised and linked them into mainstream development 2. Promote active citizenship, ethnic and social cohesion for a just, equitable and pluralistic society 3. Strengthening and sustaining development partnerships and networking, policy & advocacy 4. Policy interventions and innovative approaches for sustained economic growth that is socially equitable and ecologically sound with peace and stability The expected results are; Increased unifications and coordination of actions within the NGO sector, NGOs commit resources and times, Equal spaces for NGOs in the network structure, Number of DCs / NGOs brought together, Frequency of regular meetings of network members. Thematic focus Democracy, Conflict and justice
This project mainly contributes to results within Enabling environment for civil society. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
